locations.title: Ibiza
locations.subtitle: Spain
locations.description: Ibiza is a nightclub mecca, and every party hound must make a pilgrimage there at least once. The parties in Ibiza aren’t as much clubs as they are life experiences.

locations.title: Bangkok
locations.subtitle: Thailand
locations.description: From the backpacker haven of Khao San Road, to the rock bars near Ratchathewi, to the trendy pubs in Thlonglor and Ekamai, travellers to Bangkok have a plethora of options for their nighttime revelries.

locations.title: Hong Kong
locations.subtitle: Hong Kong
locations.description: Hong Kong’s hustle-and-bustle doesn’t end when the clock strikes ten. This cosmopolitan city’s wide array of clubs, bars, and evening markets offer multiple opportunities for late-night fun.

locations.title: Buenos Aires
locations.subtitle: Argentina
locations.description: A night out in Buenos Aires isn’t for the faint of heart. The party doesn’t get started until well after midnight in the city that invented tango.

locations.title: Berlin
locations.subtitle: Germany
locations.description: Berliners live for the night, whether they spend it in 1920s-style cabarets, retro-chic bars, or convivial beer gardens. Some of Europe’s top DJs play in mega clubs like industrial-chic Berghain. In summer, relaxed open-air bars by the River Spree keep the party going all day long.

locations.title: Las Vegas
locations.subtitle: Nevada
locations.description: Vegas has something for everybody. You’ll find every sinful whim catered for at someplace on The Strip. While The Strip is the main attraction, travellers looking for a less-flashy alternative to all the raucous commotion should head to Fremont Street.

location.s: Las Vegas (and vicinity), Nevada, United States of America

locations.title: Miami
locations.subtitle: Florida
locations.description: The nightlife has always been hopping, and the chic South Beach area leads the party pack. You’ll find everything from plush lounges to deafening dance clubs lining the art-deco streets. Come dressed to impress.

location.s: Miami (and vicinity), Florida, United States of America

locations.title: Montreal
locations.subtitle: Canada
locations.description: Enjoy the joie de vivre of Old World cafés, cool jazz clubs, packed discos, and rowdy late-night bars in the yet-to-be-discovered party gem of North America.

locations.title: Rio de Janeiro
locations.subtitle: Brazil
locations.description: Full of passion, soul, and spirit, Rio’s party season doesn’t stop when Carnival does. Locals and tourists alike drink, flirt, and dance year-round at nightclubs, bars, and street and beach parties.

locations.title: New York
locations.subtitle: New York
locations.description: Whether it’s participating in a never-ending bar crawl in the East Village, sipping cocktails in a trendy SoHo lounge, or dancing the night away at a warehouse party in Brooklyn, you’ll be sure to find something that strikes your fancy in the city that never sleeps.

location.s: New York (and vicinity), New York, United States of America

locations.title: Tokyo
locations.subtitle: Japan
locations.description: Tokyo’s international spirit is reflected in its nightlife, as visitors can find everything from live music and bars to traditional Japanese Kabuki shows.

locations.title: Kyoto
locations.subtitle: Japan
locations.description: With its rich culture and natural beauty, Kyoto never disappoints. Explore the many World Heritage-listed temples and shrines in this beautiful Japanese city. -Nao K.

locations.title: Pensacola
locations.subtitle: Florida
locations.description: Fort Pickens is a national park in Pensacola that’s great for exploring old forts, camping, wildlife observing, and sun bathing. Its beaches are more remote than bustling Pensacola Beach, but still boast the sparkling white sand of the Gulf Coast. -Tarran V.

location.s: Pensacola (and vicinity), Florida, United States of America

locations.title: Corniglia
locations.subtitle: Italy
locations.description: Corniglia is the smallest of the towns in the Cinque Terre, but no less beautiful. This city is up and away from the sea, so fewer tourists take the time to visit. Their loss! -Lacie T.

locations.title: Marrakech
locations.subtitle: Morocco
locations.description: Head to Marrakech and climb nearby Mount Toubkal in the breathtaking Atlas Mountains. Ride camels through the desert, savor the local food flavors, and learn more about Marrakech’s ancient history and culture. -Steven V.

locations.title: Williamsburg
locations.subtitle: Virginia
locations.description: Immerse yourself in the history of loyalists and rebels in Colonial Williamsburg and nearby Yorktown and Jamestown. Be transported to a bygone era and experience early American colonial life through food, historic architecture, ships, and more. -Eric W.

location.s: Williamsburg, Virginia, United States of America

locations.title: Baltra
locations.subtitle: Ecuador
locations.description: Once you see the Galapagos Islands, you’ll understand Darwin’s obsession with them. Each island has variants of species that have evolved differently due to geographic isolation. A trip to Baltra Island is a biology lesson packed into one of the most beautiful places on Earth. -Eric G.

locations.title: San Pedro de Atacama
locations.subtitle: Chile
locations.description: San Pedro de Atacama is an oasis located in the driest desert in the world. San Pedro is great for mountain biking, observing flamingos in a salt flat, or taking a dip in natural hot springs. The sandboarding is epic too! -Eric G.

locations.title: Cape Town
locations.subtitle: South Africa
locations.description: Tucked between mountains in the stunning Cape Winelands, Franschhoek features some of the country’s top restaurants and wineries. As one of South Africa’s oldest towns, its impressive history and breathtaking scenery alone make it worth visiting. -Susanna V.

locations.title: Ghent
locations.subtitle: Belgium
locations.description: Ghent is a charming city with a vibrant mix of historic and contemporary sights, from medieval architecture and beautiful canals to breweries and delightful cafés. It’s a hidden treasure with a lot to offer those looking for a Belgian adventure. -Cristen D.

locations.title: Traverse City
locations.subtitle: Michigan
locations.description: Situated on the gorgeous Grand Traverse Bay, Traverse City appeals to those who enjoy fine dining, film festivals, bicycling, golf, wine, or even cherries. The relaxed atmosphere along with the great food and gorgeous views makes it an amazing place to visit. -Shawn P.

location.s: Traverse City (and vicinity), Michigan, United States of America

locations.title: La Fortuna
locations.subtitle: Costa Rica
locations.description: In La Fortuna, you can hike the massive Arenal volcano and recuperate while soaking in the geothermal hot springs of numerous nearby spas. And don’t miss the Monteverde Cloud Forest, just a short drive away, where you can enjoy exotic flora and fauna. -Suzi F.

locations.title: Siem Reap
locations.subtitle: Cambodia
locations.description: Home to ancient temples such as Angkor Wat and Angkor Thom, Siem Reap’s magnificent historical sites offer a trip of a lifetime and an unforgettable cultural experience. -David Y.

locations.title: Beijing
locations.subtitle: China
locations.description: Built as early as the 7th Century BC, the iconic 13,170 mile-long Great Wall of China has attracted over ten million visitors a year. Take a sled ride down the Great Wall for an unbelievable adrenaline rush and unforgettable views.

locations.title: Lima
locations.subtitle: Peru
locations.description: Paragliding allows fliers to soar above the ocean and cliffs for a magical aerial view of the Peruvian coastline. Lima is also known for its culinary delights, so be sure to check out the latest restaurants and markets.

locations.title: Munich
locations.subtitle: Germany
locations.description: If beer and bratwursts aren’t enough, Bavaria offers yet another delight! Hanging tree tents allow you to spend the night in a unique way, suspended in a tree, where you’ll be treated to gorgeous views of the sunrise and sunset.

locations.title: Benidorm
locations.subtitle: Spain
locations.description: Who says you can’t rock climb in winter? Benidorm offers sunny skies and ideal climbing conditions from autumn to spring. If you’d prefer two feet on the ground, the crystal clear waters of Playa Levante and endless nightlife options are a huge draw for adventure seekers.

locations.title: Boracay
locations.subtitle: Philippines
locations.description: Kitesurfing is a way of life here! With world-renowned conditions and an excellent kitesurfing school, beginners and experts alike partake in this exhilarating sport.

locations.title: Port Lincoln
locations.subtitle: Australia
locations.description: If scuba diving alone isn’t enough, Port Lincoln offers plenty 'to-do's for your bucket list, including diving with great white sharks!

location.s: Port Lincoln (and vicinity), South Australia, Australia

locations.title: Dubai
locations.subtitle: United Arab Emirates
locations.description: Sandboarding, the summer alternative to snowboarding, lets you experience nature in a whole new way. Glide down sand dunes in Dubai and you’ll never look at the desert the same way again.

locations.title: Livingstone
locations.subtitle: Zambia
locations.description: Experience the spellbinding Victoria Falls, one of the largest waterfalls in the world, while traversing the hanging bridge across the gorge between Zambia and Zimbabwe. Want more of an adrenaline rush? You can also bungee jump from the bridge itself, 400 feet above the water.

locations.title: Arusha
locations.subtitle: Tanzania
locations.description: Famous for having one of the oldest ecosystems on earth, Serengeti National Park is visited by over 90,000 tourists each year. Plan your trip for October and November for breathtaking views of the massive migration of wildebeests and zebras.

locations.title: Copenhagen
locations.subtitle: Denmark
locations.description: One of the world’s most famous amusement parks, Tivoli Gardens, transcends itself in the winter with over 111,000 custom-designed lights that shine alongside carefully landscaped flowers and architecture.

locations.title: New York City
locations.subtitle: New York
locations.description: There’s never a shortage of things to do in the Big Apple, and the winter season is no exception. Visitors can catch the Radio City Rockettes, admire the giant Christmas tree in Rockefeller Center, or stroll through snow-covered Central Park.

location.s: New York (and vicinity), New York, United States of America

locations.title: Reykjavik
locations.subtitle: Iceland
locations.description: Long nights are perfect for viewing the Northern Lights dancing through the sky. Visitors can also warm up underneath the stars in geothermal pools, or get their thrills glacier climbing.

locations.title: Anchorage
locations.subtitle: Alaska
locations.description: Stunning winter views provide the perfect terrain for a snowshoe hike or ice-fishing expedition. Additionally, the Anchorage Fur Rendezvous Festival boasts snow carving competitions, carnival rides, and musical performances.

location.s: Anchorage (and vicinity), Alaska, United States of America

locations.title: London
locations.subtitle: United Kingdom
locations.description: Prepare to be amazed by the magical ice kingdom that transforms Hyde Park in winter. Revellers may enjoy the park’s spectacular circus, thrilling rides, and festive holiday markets.

locations.title: Ebensee
locations.subtitle: Austria
locations.description: If you’ve ever wanted to learn how to build an igloo, winter in Austria is the perfect time to try. Snowshoeing, tobogganing, and skiing are also popular things to do.

locations.title: Harbin
locations.subtitle: China
locations.description: Come be dazzled by the art collection at the Harbin Ice Festival. Attendees can ooh and aah at the Zhaolin Garden ice-lantern exhibition, and marvel at the enormous snow buildings—made from blocks of ice 2–3 inches thick taken directly from the Songhua River.

locations.title: Asahikawa
locations.subtitle: Japan
locations.description: The Asahikawa Winter Festival celebrates the long Hokkaido winter with larger-than-life ice sculptures and music performances. If you’re in town, be sure to also stop by the nearby Sapporo Snow Festival.

locations.title: Park City
locations.subtitle: Utah
locations.description: Aside from the excellent ski conditions, Park City is the proud host of the annual Sundance Film Festival, the premier showcase for independent film.

location.s: Park City (and vicinity), Utah, United States of America

locations.title: Saas-Fee
locations.subtitle: Switzerland
locations.description: Shimmering ice sculptures await visitors of the fairy glacier. Take the world’s highest lying subway to one of the world’s largest ice pavilions, where a 70-meter long tunnel leads to ice that dates back thousands of years.

locations.title: Las Vegas
locations.subtitle: Nevada
locations.description: Headliners of the stage aren’t the only big names in Vegas. In recent years, celebrity chefs (Michelin-starred and TV chefs alike) have set up their own culinary residences in Sin City.

location.s: Las Vegas (and vicinity), Nevada, United States of America

locations.title: Honolulu
locations.subtitle: Hawaii
locations.description: While you soak up the sun on one of Oahu’s gorgeous beaches, your taste buds will delight in their own paradise as you dine on kalua (slow-cooked) pork, multi-ethnic mixed plates, poke, and shave ice.

location.s: Honolulu, Hawaii, United States of America

locations.title: Boston
locations.subtitle: Massachusetts
locations.description: While it’s known for its incredible seafood (clam chowder, lobster, fish and chips, to name a few), Boston also has a thriving ethnic food scene, incredible high-end foodie restaurants, and farmers markets for everything in between.

location.s: Boston (and vicinity), Massachusetts, United States of America

locations.title: Austin
locations.subtitle: Texas
locations.description: Known for having some of the best barbecue in the States, don’t think brisket and short ribs are all you can find in the capital of Texas. Austin is also home to amazing Tex-Mex and Japanese eateries, as well as a vibrant food truck scene.

location.s: Austin (and vicinity), Texas, United States of America

locations.title: Chicago
locations.subtitle: Illinois
locations.description: Beyond its iconic deep-dish pizza, Chicago-style hot dogs, and Italian beef sandwiches, the Windy City is quickly making a name for itself as a gourmet getaway with a culinary scene of marquee chefs who operate downscaled, affordable spin-off restaurants.

location.s: Chicago (and vicinity), Illinois, United States of America

locations.title: Los Angeles
locations.subtitle: California
locations.description: The City of Angels prides itself on being a culinary trendsetter and is home to celebrity chefs, a convoy of food trucks, and pop-up restaurants.

location.s: Los Angeles (and vicinity), California, United States of America

locations.title: Portland
locations.subtitle: Oregon
locations.description: With its more than 200 food trucks and extensive selection of farm-to-table eateries, well-crafted microbrews, and artisan coffee shops, super-green Portland has earned its reputation as a young and vibrant city that is hip to new foodie trends.

location.s: Portland (and vicinity), Oregon, United States of America

locations.title: New Orleans
locations.subtitle: Louisiana
locations.description: Let the good times roll in "Nawlins" as you indulge in the best that Creole and Cajun cuisine have to offer, including jambalaya, gumbo, crawfish etouffe, and beignets!

location.s: New Orleans (and vicinity), Louisiana, United States of America

locations.title: San Francisco
locations.subtitle: California
locations.description: With more than 3,500 restaurants (the most per capita than any other city in the United States) and culinary delights from farmers markets and food trucks, it’s no wonder that visitors leave both their heart and stomach in San Francisco.

location.s: San Francisco (and vicinity), California, United States of America

locations.title: New York
locations.subtitle: New York
locations.description: Welcome to the Big Apple, where you can find virtually every type of cuisine and eat well at any price point. From fine dining from celebrity chefs to ethnic fare from some of the city’s famous street vendors, this foodie mecca will surely have something to satisfy your every craving.

location.s: New York (and vicinity), New York, United States of America

locations.title: Singapore
locations.subtitle: Singapore
locations.description: This tiny island scores big on tourism with its East meets West vibe. Switch things up from sophisticated shopping, dining and entertainment offerings to vibrant and colourful ethnic districts.

locations.title: London
locations.subtitle: UK
locations.description: London and its renowned attractions such as the British Museum, Tower of London, Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey are royalty on any traveller’s list.

locations.title: Dubai
locations.subtitle: UAE
locations.description: Dream big is what Dubai does when it comes to tourism. From mega shopping malls and glistening skyscrapers to palm-shaped articifial islands, nobody does it quite like this impressive emirate.

locations.title: Paris
locations.subtitle: France
locations.description: Travellers have an endless love affair with Paris; its variety of museums, monuments, cafes, fine dining and tree-lined boulevards and joie de vivre keep them coming back for more.

locations.title: New York
locations.subtitle: USA
locations.description: Immortalised in song, what hasn’t been said about the great city that rules the ranks when it comes to just about anything - culture, history, art, theatre, food and entertainment.

location.s: Manhattan, New York, United States of America

locations.title: Knowloon
locations.subtitle: Hong Kong
locations.description: Indulge in Dim Sum at Tim Ho Wan, Mongkok. Shop on Tung Choi Street. Visit Temple street night market. Party up at Tsim Sha Tsui. Take a ferry from Kowloon.

locations.title: Mumbai
locations.subtitle: India
locations.description: India’s financial, commercial and entertainment capital is at once eclectic and cosmopolitan. Whether you’re after museums, art galleries, luxury shopping or authentic experiences, Mumbai has both sides, and everything between, covered.

locations.title: Delhi
locations.subtitle: India
locations.description: Great sandstone carcass of Red Fort. Shopping for Indian craft on Janpath. Visit bazaars of Old Delhi. Stroll through Lodhi Gardens. Discover Qutab Minar the tallest brick minaret in the world.

locations.title: Bankok
locations.subtitle: Thailand
locations.description: Discover Wat Arun, the Temple of Dawn. Visit the Floating market and Chinatown at Yaowarat. Visit Wat Pho the old city. Shop at Chatuchak over the weekend. Party at at Khao San.

locations.title: San Francisco
locations.subtitle: USA
locations.description: Slurp clam chowder on Fisherman’s wharf. Take a walk throughGolden gate bridge. Climb upLombard street. Visit the farmer’s market at Ferry terminal. Watch a Giant’s game at the AT&T stadium

location.s: San Francisco (and vicinity), California, United States of America

locations.title: Bangalore
locations.subtitle: India
locations.description: Visit Bangalore Palace. Discover Ulsoor Lake. Take a stroll through Cubbon Park. Get a taste of local delights in the local temples of Malleswaram.
